page.title: 12PRIMARY SCHOOLS
page.content: SAINT LUKE'S CHURCH OF ENGLAND This school was opened in January 1864,for 76 pupils.By 1884 there were 167 children registered although few attended regularly as they were needed to work in the fields and many families could not afford the few pence asked. In 1954,due to lack of funds,the church asked for the school to be taken over by the State and became Voluntary Controlled.Much needed improvements were then able to take place. MILLDENE COUNTY PRIMARY Due to the population explosion of the 1960's a new primary school was needed and Milldene Primary School was opened in September 1968 with 215 pupils.
